messages.subject: Re: babies and TV, was Continuum concept and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... inconvenience ... For Mad About You, I knew this, but I thought at least they d be *home* a lot, with the baby sleeping in the next room, using the cry to
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Robyn Coburn"
<dezigna@c...> wrote:
> One of the major reasons for that is the immense expense and
inconvenience
> of using babies in shooting.

For Mad About You, I knew this, but I thought at least they'd be
*home* a lot, with the baby sleeping in the next room, using the cry
to interrupt scenes, etc. But no -- there were ridiculous episodes
with Jamie hanging out in a towel on rooftops and Paul wandering
around the city, looking for Jamie and seeing blue because he took
Viagra. (I swear I'm not making this up.)

My life was completely, totally changed. Forever.

Theirs, not so much.

:)

Amy
